item.name: Number of network interfaces
item.description: The number of network interfaces (regardless of their current state) present on this system.

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces
discovery_rule.description:
You may also consider using IF-MIB::ifType or IF-MIB::ifAlias for discovery depending on your filtering needs.
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Admin status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The desired state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Description of interface $1
item_prototype.description: A textual string containing information about the interface. This string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name and the version of the interface hardware/software.

item_prototype.name: Inbound broadcast packages on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInBroadcastPkts.

item_prototype.name: Inbound multicast packages on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer. For a MAC layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInMulticastPkts.

item_prototype.name: Inbound traffic on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets in valid MAC frames received on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: Inbound unicast packages on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInUcastPkts.

item_prototype.name: Outbound broadcast packages on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutBroadcastPkts.

item_prototype.name: Outbound multicast packages on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. For a MAC layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutMulticastPkts.

item_prototype.name: Outbound traffic on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets transmitted in MAC frames on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: Outbound unicast packages on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutUcastPkts.

item_prototype.name: Nominal or current bandwidth of interface $1
item_prototype.description: An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to `n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Inbound discards on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

item_prototype.name: Inbound errors on interface $1
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

item_prototype.name: Operational status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Outbound discards on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

item_prototype.name: Outbound errors on interface $1
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that could not be transmitted because of errors.

trigger_prototype.name: Inbound utilization is high (> $2 % over {$SNMPV2_INTERFACES_HC_IN_UTILIZATION_WARNING_TIME:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}) on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE} ({#IFALIAS})

dependency.name: Inbound utilization is very high (> $2 % over {$SNMPV2_INTERFACES_HC_IN_UTILIZATION_HIGH_TIME:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}) on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE} ({#IFALIAS})

trigger_prototype.name: Inbound utilization is very high (> $2 % over {$SNMPV2_INTERFACES_HC_IN_UTILIZATION_HIGH_TIME:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}) on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE} ({#IFALIAS})

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMPv2 Interfaces HC:ifOperStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}=2 and {Template SNMPv2 Interfaces HC:ifAdminStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last(0)}=1
trigger_prototype.name: Operational status down on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE} ({#IFALIAS})
Operational status was changed on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE} ({#IFALIAS})
Outbound utilization is high (> $2 % over {$SNMPV2_INTERFACES_HC_OUT_UTILIZATION_WARNING_TIME:"{#SNMPVALUE}"} on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE} ({#IFALIAS})

dependency.name: Outbound utilization is very high (> $2 % over {$SNMPV2_INTERFACES_HC_OUT_UTILIZATION_HIGH_TIME:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}) on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE} ({#IFALIAS})

trigger_prototype.name: Outbound utilization is very high (> $2 % over {$SNMPV2_INTERFACES_HC_OUT_UTILIZATION_HIGH_TIME:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}) on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE} ({#IFALIAS})
